citation.article-title: Coraliomargarita akajimensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the phylum 'Verrucomicrobia' isolated from seawater in Japan.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Coraliomargarita (Co.ra′li.o.mar.ga.ri′ta. Gr. n. koralion coral; L. fem. n. margarita a pearl; N.L. fem. n. Coraliomargarita coral pearl, referring to a white-colony-forming, coccoid micro-organism isolated from seawater in a sample bottle of hard coral).
Cells are Gram-negative, obligately aerobic cocci.
Cells lack flagella and are non-motile.
The major respiratory quinone is MK-7.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain of the type species is 53.9 mol%.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are C14 : 0, C18 : 1ω9c and C18 : 0.
The type species is Coraliomargarita akajimensis.
